programme.desc: In August of 2014, Russian cosmonauts aboard the International Space Station discovered something incredibly unexpected covering parts of the windows - living sea plankton. If sea life can thrive in space, might the reverse be true as well?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The ancient legends of the Norse read like modern science-fiction, with powerful gods wielding incredible weapons and high technology. Could it be that these mythological tales are based on extraterrestrial beings who visit our planet even now?

programme.title: Bermuda Triangle: Into Cursed Waters
programme.desc: Two British passenger planes, nearly identical, named the Star Tiger and the Star Ariel vanished in the 1940s. They disappear one year apart, nearly to the day. The team is targeting an unidentified wreck that might be Star Ariel.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While the team uncovers a surprising find on Lot 5, members of the Fellowship arrive in Europe and immediately discover more Templar connections.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Throughout all of recorded history, gold was used in everything from ornamentation to the creation of sacred objects. Is it possible that objects made of gold actually have some sort of power over us -- perhaps one that we don’t fully understand?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Things get scary when a seller comes in with a letter from Stephen King. Will all work and no play make Corey a dull boy? Corey pays lip service to a Harrison family tradition when a James Bond poster comes in. Does he spy a deal?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a customer walks into the shop with a signature worthy of presidential praise, can Corey make a new deal? A magician has an enchanting car once owned by Siegfried and Roy. Will Rick and Corey conjure up the right price before it disappears?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Dr. J. Allen Hynek was a pioneering scientist. Yet, he is best known as the notorious government UFO debunker who became one of the founding fathers of ufology. Was Dr. Hynek right when he concluded that there is a non-human intelligence on Earth?

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: As the team performs new scientific tests on the ceramic material found in the Mesa, they uncover evidence that something top secret may be buried on Skinwalker Ranch.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: A loyal viewer might have captured an image of an alien probe. The identify of a bizarre creature spotted on a driveway camera. The legendary Men in Black might have called a man and threatened him. A family survived a bolt of lightning.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Enormous manmade caves... Unexplainable structures... And underwater discoveries that challenge everything we know about the past...Is it possible that an advanced civilization inhabited Earth thousands of years ago?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a seller brings in a signed Righteous Brothers record, will it leave Rick and Corey with that lovin feeling? Then, will Chum be ready to jump through hoops when checking out a pull-apart circus toy from the 1920s?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Enormous manmade caves... Unexplainable structures... And underwater discoveries that challenge everything we know about the past...Is it possible that an advanced civilization inhabited Earth thousands of years ago?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A Summer storm sweeps across the valley and a nervous Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends scamper into a cave with Big Nutbrown Hare. They are all safe and dry in the cave, but the thunder outside is still scary. Big Nutbrown Hare explains that noises can’t hurt you… but will he help them overcome their fears enough to enjoy the storm and the wonders of nature that it brings?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A lazy Summer’s day brings a wonderful discovery for Little Nutbrown Hare… a tree full of bright, beautiful, tasty plums! Little Nutbrown Hare isn’t the only one enjoying the juicy summer fruit, it seems like every animal in the meadow has come for a taste. As the Summer goes on the plums disappear and Little Nutbrown Hare begins to wonder what all the animals will do without them.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class are playing hide and seek but Paxton is too noisy. Can you find Timmy and his friends in the garden?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is in the kitchen preparing his breakfast. In this instance, just like most others, it’s a plateful of socks. Before he tucks in, he notices the fridge door is open. He jumps down from the breakfast table to shut it. “How do these things stick to the fridge?” he says looking at the collection of colourful magnets. “What are they? Why don’t they fall off? It’s like magic?” He vortexes himself to Okido to find out. He joins Zoe and Felix in the garden, who are busy packing things to take with them to the beach. At the command of Messy’s whistle, Okidoodle whizzes out of the garage and they’re on their way.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, it’s a hot sunny day and Messy is playing outside in the sand pit. He tries to make some shade to cool himself down but in the process his ice lolly disappears! He wonders where it could have so he goes to Okido to find out. He lands with a soft, crunchy thud and looks around - thick white snow is everywhere! He finds Zoe and Felix in the garden who invite him to come and play in the park. Zoe and Felix decide to make “the biggest snowman Okido has EVER seen’’. Messy gets distracted by some giant footprints. He follows the trail and finds a large friendly snow creature called Snowden!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Blueberry invites Huck to attend Berry Bitty City’s big Masquerade Ball in honor of their new dog park. Unfortunately, Blueberry gets a cold and has to stay home. To keep Huck from being disappointed, Lemon decides to fill in for Blueberry at the Ball, unaware that Raspberry is doing the same thing! At the ball, “Blueberry” (actually Lemon) shows up, saying she feels all better. Later, Strawberry sees Blueberry again in another part of the park, unaware it’s Raspberry in an identical Blueberry disguise. Strawberry is increasingly puzzled at “Blueberry’s” strange behavior, and doubly puzzled to see Lemon’s puppy, and later Raspberry’s puppy, following her around.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to surprise Mom when she returns home from shopping - so he decides he will play her some music.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is impressed when he learns that Firemen dont just put out fires, they also rescue people.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: At the Pacific Ocean, Kai, working on an animal translator, accidentally discovers a stranded Sperm Whale on the shore. Katie, Leo, and Hero come to the rescue. Katie uses her invention, the PlatyPully, to try and pull the whale back to deeper waters, but things go awry when the whale panics to the pull of the PlatyPully and causes PlatypusOne with the rangers on it, to be thrashed around. Ranger Rocky appears and helps the rangers, anchoring them down. With the help of Kais translator, they use the whales clicking sounds to communicate and successfully let the whale know of their intentions to pull it to safety. The whale then allows itself to be pulled gently farther into the ocean. But suddenly, they are met with a challenge as the whale gets distracted by a squid but with PlatypusOne’s volume increased and clicks used to communicate with it, the whale then continues following them until it is finally fully submerged deep into the ocean, where it belongs. Back at the Garden, Hero creatively uses the Platypully to retrieve an apple, which ends up flying out the window.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day two visitors come to the Island of Sodor to take pictures of interesting engines. At first Bert finds them very polite. They drive their little blue car along the line, racing ahead of him and stop to take pictures as they go past. But they don’t bother waving or saying hello and when they drive through a puddle Bert gets splashed with muddy water and decides they are very rude. He decides to get his own back by using his steam to make water rain down on them from the wet branches, but the Small Controller is not very happy with him.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Duck’s driver boils an egg in his whistle it leaves Duck making a very funny sound. The other engines think it is very funny, but Mike insists that an engine that can’t whistle is not a proper engine. Mike can be grumpy and tends to overheat, but when he loses his temper with a cow later that day he blows his own whistle cap right off and into a field. Now Mike can’t whistle properly and he’s not very happy about it. He can’t see the funny side of the situation as easily as his friends Rex and Bert.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Because of a domestic accident, Fumes hurt his foot and his wing. He must stay at home and not move at all. At Davids request, Grisu agrees to take care of his father as a nurse. But Fume is an unbearable patient and Grisu ends up giving in to his whims: to go and get a pizza at Marias. The journey turns into an adventure and Grisu realizes that the city is definitely not made for the disabled. For the return trip, he builds a kind of racing kart. Fume is so happy that he feels much better now, ready to go back for another pizza

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisus mission is to replace David in a camping trip where he was supposed to take the children. But his father accompanies them and makes a lot of mistakes, pretending he knows everything about camping! Grisu ends up burning the tent. Fortunately, he has the idea to make clay tiles with the help of his fathers flame. And so, he makes a shelter for him and his friends.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Summer is at its hottest and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse want to run and play but the sun is just too hot and strong. That’s until Little Grey Squirrel gives them both a wonderful present, big leafy parasols. When he later changes his mind and takes Little Nutbrown Hare’s parasol back, the little hare is naturally disappointed. Can the friends find a way for all of them to be happy?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: You Summer in the meadow is a great time to find tasty snacks to eat. Big Nutbrown Hare seems to know all the best tricks and hiding spots for the yummy treats and Little Nutbrown Hare can’t help but wish he was as big and smart as his father. However, he soon finds out that there are some things a little Nutbrown Hare can teach a Big Nutbrown Hare.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn her badge, Koko has to deliver two different types of cargo safely. She goes too fast and nearly breaks her cargo of eggs – then goes too slow, and is nearly late with her cargo of wool. Happily, she realises that different cargos need different delivery methods: slow and steady with the eggs, but faster with the wool. Learning the difference means that she wins her badge!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmund falls on the floor during the burrows big springcleaning. Nothing serious fortunately, but he needs to rest and take a day off. But he neither has time nor is used to rest! As ld get worse if he doesn’t keep his anklestill all day, Berry, Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy do their best to make sure that their father rests without getting bored.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Tonight the Fixham Medieval Festival will open, but Maria Madison is appalled to discover that the castle has no portcullis. She summons Bob to put one in. Meanwhile Mr Bentley puts his foot through a rotten section of drawbridge as he eagerly heads into the castle to rehearse his lines. Leo becomes distracted role-playing as Prince Fix-a-Lot and traps himself behind the portcullis and inside the castle where he can hear a ghost wailing! Bob and the team hatch a plan to break into the castle to rescue Leo. First they fit a new drawbridge in place of the rotten one so that Muck can drive across and raise the portcullis with his bucket. Bob bravely ventures into the castle, saving Max and exposing the real ghost.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Saffi declares that Wendy is her hero. She then tells the Spring City Rockets that her hero is going to build them a fancy tree house so that they can have their first ever club meeting. Wendy wants to live up to her hero status and re-organises the schedule so that the elaborate tree house is ready by the end of the day. But things don’t quite go to schedule when Saffi tries to help out. Saffi arranges furniture on wet paint and then causes Wendy to stick to adhesive. Things then get worse when Saffi uses the tree-house before it is ready, causing it to collapse. Now not only does Wendy have to save the collapsing tree-house but also the Rockets prize cup. With the help of Bob, Wendy dangles from a harness to retrieve the prize cup.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Peppino delivers pizzas faster than anyone in Busytown, so when the kids wait an unusually long time for their pizza to arrive, they figure something must be wrong at the pizzeria. But Peppino isnt there and neither is his delivery car. By following his delivery route, the kids ultimately find Peppino stuck in an elevator./‘Fairy dust’ and strange sightings has Hilda Hippo convinced there are real live fairies in Busytown Woods!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: While playing in the garden, Leo and Hero stumble upon a reticulated python and its eggs. The Junior Rangers drive to the rainforest to find a suitable home for the python, but an aggressive hippo makes the task a lot more difficult.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Katie identifies a large-beaked bird in the garden as an Australian pelican. The Junior Rangers bring the pelican to a lake and track down the pelican’s parents.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: With his vivid imagination, Simon the rabbit searches for fun while learning about the importance of responsibility and communication.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: There are two balls in the kindergarden. One, the big bugs play with, and one for the small bugs. One day one of the balls bursts and they all have to find a way to peacfully play with the one remaining ball. Soon they realize that they can also play together, so Stanley admits that the small bugs are not that clumsy after all.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Moonbug cant walk. The centipede always helps him to get him to where he wants to go. But one day the centipede has to go on a long journey, so the Moonbug is left to go alone to Alfonsos concert. But Eddy, the potatobeetle builds a special chair with wheels for Moonbug. The Moonbug can finally go alone to Alfonsos concert, and anywhere he wants to.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: A great storm tears down the fireflies house. The whole house breaks into peaces and all the lanterns with it. So the small firefiles go on a journey to find the wise old Shining Bug, and ask him to give them new lanterns. When the fireflies return home they are surprised by their new home, the forest friends have built them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: On a spring day, Flutter meets a group of unknown butterfly girls. The girls are happy, energetic and skitty, and Flutter is in awe of them at first. But it turns out the group always makes fun of Flutters real friends. So Flutter decides to choose her peacful way of life besides her friends.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work isnt going as fast as theyve planned, so the forest friends decide to help them. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. Since she also still hasnt gotten a costume yet, they come up with the idea to dress as the four seasons. Leapy becomes Spring, and the three bark beetles become Summer, Fall and Winter. The four seasonelves go on to win the costume contest at the party.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, something special they can all do and Bing gets frustrated when his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag all their favourite things around the house with stickers, but when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh Bing is upset because he doesnt want to share.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him a story when he has his bath but gets sad when his book gets wet. Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet, the story isnt.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly is excited for her friend Mings visit and to show her favourite spot. However, Ming keeps getting distracted. Molly eventually goes alone, but Ming finds her, and the picnic can finally begin.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert builds a tree from wood instead of cutting one down. Soon, everyone wants one too, and the friends are so busy they forget the Advent celebration. The children decorate and save the day.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly loses the sack of Christmas wishes, and Tildas oven breaks. Thankfully, a wandering craftsman returns the sack and fixes the oven. But Tilda is sad—Aunt Emily can’t come for Christmas due to a broken leg.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Big Nutbrown Hare tells Little Nutbrown Hare a beautiful full moon will rise that night, Little Nutbrown wants to invite all his friends around for a celebration. When the full moon is veiled in clouds, Little Nutbrown is disappointed - but is extra delighted when the clouds part to reveal a bright red moon.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a Midsummers night, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends decide to try to stay up all night. With the beautiful long dusk there is plenty of time for play, but one by one they drop off to sleep in the wee small hours. Luckily that leaves them plenty of energy to play the next day.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers Little Field Mouse has a wonderful collection of interesting Autumn leaves and Little Grey Squirrel has a collection of acorns of all varieties, he decides to start a collection of his own. But Little Nutbrown Hare cant decide what to collect, until his father encourages him to realise that he has a wonderful collection of memories.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is playing with a glider when he notices the super cardboard airplane with wheels on it that Ferdinand has made. He runs over to join him, boy does he ever want to try it out. OK, but before he does Simon will have to give him a hand decorating it. And Ferdinand gets to try it out first. Simon agrees and pushes him to get it rolling. Once. Twice. And when it’s Simon’s turn to go for a plane ride, it’s too late, it’s already lunch time. But what’s worse is that when he returns from the table, Ferdinand wants Simon to push him again. And this time with Gaspard too!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Katie finds out that a big fish in the garden pond is a whitespotted bamboo shark. The Junior Rangers sail to the Pacific Ocean to find a coral reef for the bamboo shark to live in.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: In order to earn his badge, Brewster has to invent a fun tour to teach a group of children a little about Chuggington. He decides to show them a Day in the Life of a Chugger – but his tour is so dull! To make matters worse, he accidentally loses his passengers. He finds them with Wilson, having a great time on the turntable. Realising that chuggers work hard, but that they have fun too, he takes his passengers on a ‘Laugh and Learn’ tour around the depot.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot have to sort some recycling bins in order to earn their Green Machine badges. Toot is anxious to go to the ride-in to see an Action Chugger movie, so she skimps on the job, skipping one of the bins to save time. The twins ask Vee for their badge - and when she tells them they haven’t earned it, they wonder how she knows. When they finish the job properly, they find their badge at the bottom of the bin they skipped!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: It’s Father’s Day today. But neither T’choupi nor Nina can come up with a good idea for a special present for their respective dads. Benedicte suggests they gather up various objects from the forest and make drawings with them, on the ground. Great idea… except land art turns out to be a bit more complicated than they expected. And, more importantly, are their dads even going to like it?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina come across a waddling hedgehog while they’re playing in the vegetable garden. When their moms explain how beneficial these cute little creatures are to gardens, the two friends decide to do everything they can to make the hedgehog feel at home among the vegetables… Until the little animal… disappears!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi comes down for breakfast this particular morning, he finds the kitchen in a total mess! Nina comes and tells him that the vegetable garden has also been turned upside down! Who could possibly have done this?... At first, they suspect Ciboulette the cat… until they find out that the culprit is a super cute newcomer.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Andy cant wait to introduce Teddy, the teddy bear he received as a present. But Jeanne has received exactly the same teddy bear! And Andy doesnt want a girls teddy! So he quickly - but badly - hides Teddy. Andy discovers the teddy, thinking hes lost...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Ella demands to be the one who decides while playing games with Sam and Julia. But her two friends think the leader should rather be the one who is the most efficient at each game...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: A former resident comes back to visit the flat she used to live in when she was a child : Julias. She had forgotten there a music box. Julia has found the toy but is reluctant to give it back...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Its Ellas birthday. What can Sam and Julia give to a little mouse who already has everything in her room? After a few wanderings, they will find something that really pleases their friend.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas has a run of bad luck, he tries everything to get back on track... even if it means following Lorenzos strange, superstitious advice!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas travels to Australia where he helps his friend Ace overcome his fear of animals so that he can compete in a super stunt rally.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou visits the aquarium on a school trip and spots a seahorse, a scuba diver and a sea lion!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to the lake to celebrate the Fourth of July.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: All the balls at Farmer Patrick Pigs new mini putt are disappearing. After much investigation Huckle and the gang track the missing balls to Patricks record breaking ‘egg laying’ chicken. / When the gold coins Mr Fix It finds on the beach disappear, Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to find out where they went.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Want to meet one of Monkey’s fastest friends? Well he would too if he can only get it to stop… when he finally does succeed, Monkey invites Ostrich to play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”! With Ostrich slowly showing them how, Monkey and the children learn to stretch and move their long necks, open and close their beaks, shake their tail feathers and of course, run just like Ostrich.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is very proud of his tail and the wonderful things he can do with it. He thinks his tail is the greatest until he sees Peacock’s tail. Left almost speechless, monkey offers peacock to play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”! Now monkey and the children can all be as impressive as Peacock. He shows them how to open and close their tail feathers and walk proudly about.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: This series about a fireman named Sam, his fellow firefighters, and other residents in the fictional Welsh rural village of Pontypandy

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Norman and Hannah set themselves up as The Why Files - investigators of the mysterious mysteries of Pontypandy - one of their first cases involves strange goings on near the cliffs.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When Franklin accidentally creates the “Forest Fuzzy”, a fun toy out of scrap materials from Aunt T’s Messy Make-It-shop, his friends fall in love with the critters and quickly makes their own versions. A fad is soon born and Franklin’s thrilled – until his friends lose interest and put the Fuzzies aside before he’s ready to. /After Beaver loses her voice while practicing a song for her and Franklin’s show- and-tell school presentation, the pair finally discovers there are lots of other ways to communicate besides talking.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: This morning, Rosie would like to make up a poem for her grandpa who is coming for lunch. To do so, she needs peace and quiet… and it seems quite impossible to find! Every time Rosie settles down in a peaceful area, a noise arises and disturbs her. To help her, Woodsy and Scoutbadger bring Rosie to anabandoned burrow. There, underground, there is only silence. Rosie is delighted but soon disillusioned. This total silence actually sounds worse to her than noise!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is desperate because he would have liked to play outside but there is too much wind. Doodleboo has fun because he knows a Riddleboo who loves the wind.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky does not return, he dreamed that he had the power to fly in the air and he would have wished it lasted... Doodleboo suggests Sketcky discover a Riddleboo that can fulfill all his wildest dreams!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky wants to make Bubble her Queen, but for that, he needs to be a king! But how does one become king? Doodleboo has a little idea of a Riddleboo.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave ask their friends for help finding a cure for the hiccups. Each friend offers them special solution and it’s soon clear that no one cure works for all. Ruff-Ruff discovers his hiccups go when he’s having fun digging. Tweet is cured when she giggles. Dave’s hiccups prove particularly troublesome and need a special Blue Panda banana cure! But what is it?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave help Hatty bunny-sit the three Little Bunnies. They learn the secret to successful bunny-sitting is to have them play, eat, and then sleep after their bedtime story. And they must not forget that Littlest Bunny needs his cuddly carrot to help him settle down. A special song helps them remember all the bunny-sitting rules - and makes the perfect sleepy lullaby!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Day It is the shortest day of the year so the sun doesnt rise until very late and is going to set very early. To Little Nutbrown Hare everything feels mixed up and theres no time to do all the things he wants to do. That’s until he and Little Field Mouse name it Topsy-Flopsy Day and decide to make a fun and funny day of it!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop teaches Bing and Pando how to blow bubbles. Bing finally blows a big bubble but gets upset when Pando pops it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula head off for a picnic at the paddling pool with Flop. But when they get there, they are shocked to find there is no water inside. Bing’s disappointment soon gives way to the realisation that it’s a very special pool day. With no water there are all sorts of games they can play that are usually against the pool rules.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula discover a new toy at Amma’s crèche, a talking ride on car. It seems like fun until Talkie Taxi keeps saying the same thing over and over again. When the taxi crashes and is finally silenced Bing and Sula use their imagination to play a game they really want to play without being dictated to by the noisy taxi.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: Zephyr and Leapy decide to make a little surprise box for Dr Owls most beloved belongings. They want to decorate the box with shells, so the Robin flies them to the seashore to collect the most beautiful shells. They even get some help from the Crab, and get a ride back home on a back of a turtle.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Stanley gets a silver robot from Frank as a present. The robot can move, make sounds and also flash its lights. When Stanley wants to show it to Berry, the robot slips from his hands and breaks into pieces. While Stanley and Berry are out to get some help, Bubbles finds the robot and repairs it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: During Christmas, Dr Owl gets sick, and Bubbles cant seem to wrap his head around the fact that doctors can also get sick. Flutter helps him understand that the car of a car mechanic can also break down, and the shoe of a cobbler can also get torn sometimes. So the friends make a beautiful surprise for the old doctor.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: It seems some sort of monster is causing havoc in Busytown Lake. The kids catch glimpses of it and find numerous finny footprints by the shoreline. However closer investigation reveals it to be Mr Fix-It’s latest invention – a swim fin-wheeled amphibious submarine car!/Huckle and his pals try to track down a bad driver.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is telling the kids a legend about The laughing tree that can only be found in a night of a full moon, when the owl hoots 3 times, a wolf howls twice and a monkey sneezes. All these conditions are fulfilled and they decide to fly to the forest in search of the magical tree. It is hard to find the tree in the darkness until Bat comes to their rescue.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Getting competitive over new game Alien Bug Hunt, Norman, James, Sarah and Mandy take a boat out to sea to find the last Alien Bug, but run into trouble when James falls overboard!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Station Officer Steele decides to direct his own musical and casts Norman as the lead. Norman’s love for the spotlight gets out of control lighting up the stage in the wrong way!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: While playing catch in the backyard, Kate’s ball goes over the hedge, and Kate is too small to climb over. In Mimiloo, Mim-Mim accidentally squishes one of Gobble’s pumpkins, which makes him wish he was lighter. Using one of Tack’s inventions, he becomes the weight of a balloon! But when the gang runs into trouble, only heavy Mim-Mim can help.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate and her parents are staging a talent show, but Mom is hesitant to perform. In Mimiloo, everyone is preparing for a dance party! While gathering crystals to make a disco ball, the gang gets trapped. Only Gobble’s beautiful voice can save them—but he’s too nervous to sing in public! Kate must show him there’s nothing to fear.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out walking in the forest, Benedicte sets a challenge for Tchoupi and Nina – to find their way back home all by themselves, using landmarks they come across along the way. But when they spot a squirrel, they momentarily forget to pay attention, and stray from the path back home...

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Loupiote the dog is feeling particularly playful this morning! She grabs T’choupi’s stuffed and runs off to bury it in a secret location! T’choupi manages to get his plush bear back… but its fur is covered in mud! Dad washes it… but now it’s all wet and will never be dry by tonight! Tchoupi feels down: how will he be able to sleep without his precious teddy bear?! He sets off on a quest to find a replacement… but comes back empty-handed. Nina thinks she just may have a solution: what if she were to teach him how to get to sleep… “Teddy-less?...!”

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia sleeps badly, disturbed by a nightmare that comes back every night. In order to help her find back her sleep and her dynamism, Sam invents a trap to capture bad dreams. Will it work?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Edna has a new business idea: restoring old furniture. When the twins Billy and Benny play with paint, they accidentally splatter Robin’s favourite cabinet. Edna is shocked, but Robin loves the result.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Turbulent invited his friend Kiko to sleep over, but in the middle of the night, the Triplets find out that he is a sleepwalker! Kiko is heading towards Mom’s room and if the kids don’t do anything he is going to wake her up and she won’t let him sleep over again. However, they cannot wake up Kiko either, it is said to be dangerous. Luckily, the Triplets manage to bring their friend back in bed. But what if he starts again? It is going to be a long long night!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets, Eliott and Toto are on their way to the park but, bad news, dogs are not allowed there! They tried to sneak in but were not able to get very far. What a shame! And it is the same story at the swimming pool, the bakery and even school: dogs are not welcome! The Triplets find it extremely unfair and decide to overlook these bans so that Toto can be part of the fun!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: For her dads birthday, Biva has made a beautiful model of their beavers hut. She asks Rosie to keep it and take care of it until the next day. Rosie promises she will, but fails to keep track of it, as Berry takes it to play outside… When the little vixen realizes what happened, its too late: a crow has stolen twigs from the model and destroyed it… Rosie is crestfallen: what will her best friend say?

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou helps Mommy bake a special cake for Leos birthday party!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou gets his first eye test and learns its not scary at all!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In an attempt to beat Thomas in a race, Cleo decides to use the railway lines instead of the road. She soon learns that the roads are much safer for a little car.

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: When Emery takes reporter Rag around town as he covers exciting news stories, he wishes he could get his picture in the paper! Rag tries to get an interview with the famous magician, The Magnificent Mysterioso, who has come to Chuggington to do a show. As Emery waits, he sees his chance. Smoke! The stage must be on fire! Emery uses a water cannon to put it out. Unfortunately, it wasn’t a fire at all. It was Mysterioso’s smoke machine, which is now ruined! Thanks to Emery, there’ll be no show. It looks like Emery will be on the front page - but for all the wrong reasons!

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot are double ended shunting chuggers. Hoot gets fed-up of Toot always being at the front, so Toot agrees to let him lead for the day. Hoot mixes up a delivery of red tomatoes and green apples. He also refills the spray shed with the wrong colour paint and Wilson is sprayed green instead of his usual red! Toot is upset with Hoot for getting everything wrong. They argue and split apart, going their separate ways! Toot complains that Hoot doesn’t seem to be able to tell the difference between green and red. She learns from Irving that some chuggers can’t, because they’re colourblind.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Andy cant wait to introduce Teddy, the teddy bear he received as a present. But Jeanne has received exactly the same teddy bear! And Andy doesnt want a girls teddy! So he quickly - but badly - hides Teddy. Andy discovers the teddy, thinking hes lost...

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave go in search of Littlest Bunny’s missing cuddly carrot toy. They search all the places that Little Bunny has played that day, one by one, without success. It’s only when they have learned to look carefully and check big open spaces thoroughly, by walking slowly in lines from one side to the other, that they find it. They also find Penny Hen’s lost scarf, Herman the Hermit Crab’s beach bucket and Cindy Squirrel’s missing nuts!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Whos the perfect guide for a walk in the woods? Doodleboo explains how to draw a fox

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the South African desert just before dawn, Jane and Zumi discover construction signs for a road and find some squeaking Desert Rain Frogs. In the Garden, Hero wakes Leo and Katie, sleeping in their sleeping bags, by chewing on his squeaky toy. Jane calls them and Katie provides information about the unique frogs through the computer. Concerned about the frogs displaced burrows due to construction, the rangers travel to Jane. They gather the frogs for relocation, Hero gets a little too playful with the frogs and they make their way to find the perfect place for the frogs. They meet Ranger Rocky at a meerkat burrow, who calls Ranger Joey. She provides insights into the frogs behavior and suggests a suitable environment. Meanwhile, Hero goes missing, and Janes keen hearing locates him. They find Hero near a perfect spot for the frogs, a sandy area with a termite mound. The frogs are released, and thunder rumbles, marking the beginning of the rainy season. In the Garden, Leo and Katie grant Hero some well-deserved playtime.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, Stanley, Balthazar, Flutter and Bubble are hiking in the forest on a beautiful autumn day. Suddenly they recognized that someone is crying in the bush. They found a mushroom without his hat. The friends immediately start to help him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One spring day, Frank longhorn beetle visits his friend, Stanley. Frank suggests to organize a football match. Everyone wants to play football, the two teams get together quickly. The girls cheer on the sidelines. The game is about to start.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Easter is here. The girls: Dolly, Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr and Rosita gather and start to paint the Easter eggs. They happily work all day, painting beautiful eggs.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One night Berry is already in his bed, when he hears some strange noise. First he doesnt care, but the noise just getting louder. Finally he opens the door when the little green worm appeared. Long time no see friend just arrived.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are building a sandcastle when Pando joins them in the sandpit with his wind-up digger toy to help. Bing finds a lovely ‘poiky thing’ in the sand and thinks it will make the perfect decoration for the top of his castle not realizing it belongs to Pando’s digger.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula collect acorns in the park with Flop, but Bings pile keeps shrinking.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop is feeling poorly so Bing decides to look after him. When Bing tries to make Flop a honey-lemon drink he ends up making a big mess instead.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Pando and me did music all together.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Raspberry and Lemon want to join a fashion contest. They offer Strawberry to be their model, but she is too busy running both her cafe and the market. Raspberry and Lemon meet the twins Sweet and Sour Grapes, whose names fit their personalities and offer them to replace Strawberry in the cafe.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy is looking very gloomy today, but his family has no idea why. Rosie and Scoutbadger decide to do everything they can to find out what is wrong with him. They try to make him confide in them, to follow him around discreetly, to question his friends… eventually making Woodsy angry: he doesn’t want to talk about it, and that’s it!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. With Big Nutbrown Hares help, he learns he has grown bigger since last Spring, and can now clamber into a hole in a tree thats an even better hiding place. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Big Nutbrown Hare tells Little Nutbrown Hare a beautiful full moon will rise that night, Little Nutbrown wants to invite all his friends around for a celebration. When the full moon is veiled in clouds, Little Nutbrown is disappointed - but is extra delighted when the clouds part to reveal a bright red moon.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends spend the afternoon playing hide and seek. Berry hides so well among the water lily petals that he falls asleep and drifts away on the water. Luckily, the Moon Beetle and the Moon itself help him get back home. The next day, all the little friends play a big game of hide and seek together in the meadow.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Ella demands to be the one who decides while playing games with Sam and Julia. But her two friends think the leader should rather be the one who is the most efficient at each game...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: A former resident comes back to visit the flat she used to live in when she was a child : Julias. She had forgotten there a music box. Julia has found the toy but is reluctant to give it back...

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are at the beach, and they can’t wait to go swimming!!! Unfortunately, there is a new lifeguard on the beach, and he is not the kind to let anyone have fun... The Triplets can’t either bathe, or make sandcastles, or pirouettes, or kite. What a bummer! The lifeguard whistles constantly, like a quartermaster sergeant against his soldiers. Then the Triplets are going to k really hard to escape the lifeguard and give him the hardest time, who will win this fight?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Be friend with a shark, is that even possible? Poet discovers a swimming ring shaped like a shark in the sand. He imagines being friend with a NICE shark which is tired of everyone thinking he’s bad. Turbulent and Girl take him out of his musing and ask him if he wants to join them to fish shrimps. But Poet won’t fish shrimps, no! He will find a shark and make him his new friend. He’ll bring it back to Paris where he will play with it, feed it, learn it how to brush teeth and bed it. Not sure Mommy will agree.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Zephie, Wilson, and Brewster compete to be Kokos partner in a relay race, but Koko knows that Zephie is the weakest.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Getting competitive over new game Alien Bug Hunt, Norman, James, Sarah and Mandy take a boat out to sea to find the last Alien Bug, but run into trouble when James falls overboard!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Station Officer Steele decides to direct his own musical and casts Norman as the lead. Norman’s love for the spotlight gets out of control lighting up the stage in the wrong way!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wonders what’s wrong with her birdhouse— the birds aren’t visiting it. In Mimiloo, Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends offer to babysit a shape-changing baby squoosh so its mama squoosh can focus on building a nest. But getting the squoosh to nap and eat is harder than it sounds!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate’s sad because her snowman is melting! In Mimiloo, it’s a sweltering hot day so Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends head to the Winter Waterfalls to cool down—only to find that all the ice is melting! To re-freeze the waterfalls, Kate will have to find Chilly, the snowman who keeps the Winter Waterfalls cold, snowy and frozen.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When a messy park gets in the way of his paper boat race, Caillou feels helpless to do anything about it. He dives into fantasy where the divemaster calls in some friends to help clean up the ocean. Inspired, Caillou calls in his friends and family and together they get the park clean for the boat race.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Caillou doesnt understand the rules of a game hes playing with the older kids, he feels too embarrassed and shy to ask for help. But in a fantasy quest to save a princess from a dragon, Caillou learns that there is no shame in asking questions.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Judy and Jerome, the breakdown train, have been stuck at Knapford Yard for some time – having been somewhat superseded by Rocky and even Harvey. Ryan hears their sad story and offers to take them to Arelsburgh Harbour for a change of scenery. They love it there at first but soon take advantage of other engines so they can have a tour around the island. Meanwhile, Daisy has a run in with a bull and is derailed. When Thomas goes looking for the breakdown train, it is nowhere to be found! Ryan feels responsible – not just for Daisy but also to make sure Judy And Jerome get to be Really Useful. Ryan catches up with Judy and Jerome in the end and The Fat Controller is reminded how useful they can be. He decides they will have a new home at Arlesburgh with their friends Ryan and Daisy.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A sad baby Elephant needs some cheering up (and some trunk training) when he finds himself constantly upstaged by his older brother.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A baby White Rhinoceros is trapped in a mudhole! Can the Junior Rangers get it out... and convince its protective mother that theyre just there to help?

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: It’s Christmas! And everyone’s getting ready for the pantomime. Little Lucy has a wonderful song to sing at the centre of the show but when she goes missing whilst out riding on Pumpkin the horse all that matters is to find her.. and the newly fallen snow means that Pat has to be VERY resourceful in order to find her. A snowmobile saves the day and Pat gets Lucy back - in time for the Panto and a rather special Christmas Song to celebrate. ‘’Happy Christmas Greendale Village, Happy Christmas Everyone!’’

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat and Jess set out to Cornwall to take delivery of a steam engine called Old Betty.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Nuair a tha Bing a’ cluich geama le fòn-làimhe Flop, chaneil rudan a’ dol mar bu chòir oir tha am fòn-làimhe a briseadh nuair a tha e dol na sgeing air an làr. An àite seo innse do Flop, tha Bing ga chuir dhan bhiona. Tha e faireachdainn cho dona mun seo ach tha e ag ionnsachadh gum feum e innse mar a thachair. When Bing is playing a game with Flop’s mobile phone, he accidentally drops the mobile and it breaks. Instead of telling Flop, he throws it in the bin. He feels upset about it all and learns that it’s best to tell the truth.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma watch the fireworks at Bings house. Sula doesnt like the loud bangs, so she wears ear mufflers. Bing, on the other hand, thinks he is brave enough to watch the fireworks from the garden. All of a sudden, a very loud bang sends Bing running into the house and hiding under the kitchen table. Flop makes special ear gloves for Bing to enjoy the fireworks show without having to hear the loud bangs.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If you break a special thing, you can put it in the bye-bye box and it keeps it safe.Bing is having fun with a new orange balloon when he jumps on it and breaks it. Bing is upset because he broke his balloon, so Flop helps him place the recovered pieces in the bye-bye box, which contains irreparable objects that are too valuable to throw away.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Pongo the Friendly Dragon is sad because he doesn’t have anyone his size to play with and can’t enjoy activities like riding on the seesaw. Feeling sorry for his friend, Oswald finds the perfect match for Pongo - Laverne the White Elephant - but Pongo is too shy to say hello to her. Oswald devises ways to get them together, but the clumsy Pongo keeps ruining his efforts. Finally Oswald manoeuvres both Pongo and Laverne into the basket of a hot-air balloon and sets them adrift, and they float off together, friends at last.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald takes over the ice cream route when Johnny Snowman has the sniffles. Johnny is very grateful, especially as he has a special delivery that he does every Friday afternoon. Oswald and Weenie set off but soon find that doing a job isn’t always easy. Nevertheless, Oswald and Weenie press on and end up not only making that special delivery but also selling all of the ice cream!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: At the new Skyscraper Bob and the team find that Mayor Madison wants the elevator finished so she can have her photo taken at the top. Scoop wants to see the ‘whole of Spring City’ too. He rolls into Tiny’s cage but on the way up realises that he’s not so keen after all and in panic rolls onto high up floor girders of the unfinished skyscraper. Bob embarks on a daring rescue. Realising that Bob is taking a risk to help him Scoop manages to control himself and roll back into the cage. From now on, he’d rather keep his wheels firmly on the ground!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob and the team arrive at Chef Tattie’s fun new Milk Shake Bar, Scoop sees Chef Tattie experimenting with ingredients for his milk shakes and gets inspired. Scoop decides that he will do the same when he he helps Two-Tonne mix up the concrete for the Car Park. But the next morning, it’s soon clear that Scoop’s concrete isn’t dry. Scoop has to scrape it all off so they can start again. But Bob thinks there might be something to Scoop’s idea to make a fun car park after all and gives him some crazy but ‘proper’ materials to mix up in Dizzy.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare awakes to find the leaves changing colour and falling off the trees, the flowers dropping off the bushes and the tadpoles turning into frogs. Autumn is here and it’s time for change! Little Nutbrown Hare misses the joys of the Summer meadow. Will he discover that Autumn has it’s own delights?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The cool Autumn breeze isn’t enough to deter Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse from going out to find what special experiences the day might bring. However, with the weather and wind constantly changing, it’s very hard for the friends continue playing any one game. Will the strange weather spoil their fun, or will it bring them a special experience after all?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Among the newly fallen Autumn leaves Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very peculiar little, hairy, green… ‘something’. Intrigued by what it might be Little Nutbrown Hare asks all his friends, but they all have different answers! It is certainly a very useful ‘something’, great for back scratching and games but it takes Little Grey Squirrel to solve the mystery.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: It’s snack time and everyone has a cookie. Timmy wants to share his cookie with his friends. Help Timmy cut the cookie and count.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Forgetful Mayor Fox has misplaced the giant key to the city that hes supposed to be presenting to a visiting astronaut. Huckle and his pals try to figure out where he set it down. They learn that Mayor Fox did one thing while touring a candy factory that required both his hands - stirring a huge pot of candy goo. Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, it’s Christmas Eve and Messy is just too excited. He can’t wait for Christmas day and wants to stay awake all night. He wonders why he has to go to sleep at all, so he goes to Okido to find out. When he lands in Okido he finds Zoe and Felix can’t sleep either, they’re just too excited for Mother Christmas to arrive. But wait “Mother Christmas… what kind of Christmas is this?” asks Messy. Zoe and Felix pull out their Okido Christmas story book and show Messy what happens at Christmas in Okido.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is having fun playing with his remote controlled truck. “Watch out for that sandwich… mind those socks!” he shouts as he steers the truck around his messy, make-shift obstacle course of toy bits and pieces. “He’s amazing, he’s going to win, he’s, he’s, he’s… stopped?” Messy hops down off the sofa to check what’s wrong with his motionless truck. When you need to know go to Okido! Messy lands with a skip and a bounce at Zoe and Felix’s house. Zoe and Felix open the door to let Messy inside.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The girls decide to each bake Berrykin Bloom the perfect cupcake, to be presented at a ceremony honoring him for his achievements in Berryculture. Their efforts get comically out of control as they begin competing with each other to create the biggest and best cupcake ever!

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry and the dinos discover that theres a new dinosaur in the house, and it belongs to Nana.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to sleep out in his new tent in the garden so that he can practice his scout skills.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In this adventure, Kyle discovers a vibrant Peacock Spider in the Southern Australian Forest, fascinated by its cute and colorful appearance. Curiosity piqued, he calls the Junior Rangers, interrupting their game of musical statues. Concerned about the spiders potential venom, they consult their computer for information, learning about the spiders unique features and the dance it uses for courtship. Suddenly, a female brown spider interrupts the males dance and gets aggressive to which Leo, Katie and Hero fly off to Kyle to assist him. As they arrive, the brown spider continues to chase the colorful spider which leads to chaos as the spider jumps around, onto everyone, especially Kyle. The spider eventually seeks refuge on Kyle’s hat. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky, who calls Ranger Joey to give them insights on the spiders mating dance. With newfound understanding, they assist the male spider with its dance by dancing with it together and dressing up Kyle in colorful leaves to get its attention. With everyone dancing, including Hero, the male spider finally dances again and successfully impresses the female as they crawl away together. Back at the Treehouse, Leo, Katie, and Hero continue their game of musical chairs.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: The three miniature engines are the smallest on the Island of Sodor. People love to come to see them, but sometimes they don’t seem to take them seriously, making comments about them being cute, or like toys, but not really seeing them as being useful. When it is time for the sheep’s wool to be delivered to market, the Small Controller says it is the miniature engines’ chance to prove how useful they really are. Rex takes on the job and it is all going well, until an overturned cart spills bales of wool onto the line and poor Rex ends up being derailed.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Bulgy thinks people should travel by bus instead of rail, and when he sees an accident at the construction site that pollutes the water tower, he does not tell anyone.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: After an expedition to the Jungle, Doctor Natureza finds out that a little monkey, Simmy, hid in her plane and followed her to Dragontown. Grisu has to help Natureza to bring the monkey back and reintroduce into the wild. But Simmy doesn’t seem to be in a rush to return to wildlife and, being quite cheeky and lively, it gives Grisu a hard time. Eventually, the little dragon finds out that the monkey needs to make peace with its brother Sammy, and after that the two apes return to their home in the Jungle together

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Olivia and Sandro are preparing orienteering training for the crew. David and Steffan are to meet them but have been called to another mission. But they can’t let Olivia and Steffan know as their walkie-talkie isn’t working. Grisu volunteers to deliver the message with Stella’s help and following the map Olivia has prepared. But they must get to the firefighters before the enter the cave at the end of the trail. Grisu and Stella have to work without a compass after Fume breaks it; but using traditional navigation methods and with an ingenious invention from Grisu when all seems lost, the manage to deliver their message just in time.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On Summer’s hottest night Little Nutbrown Hare finds it hard to sleep. When a swim in the river isn’t enough to cool him down, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends ask Little White Owl to tell them a really cold and sleepy bedtime story. Will she come up with a story that can make them feel cool and finally get Little Nutbrown Hare off to sleep?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is impressed by Blue Bird’s description of a flowery field that looks just like a sea of colour from her bird’s eye view. He visits the field with Big Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, and they discover that everyone has their own unique view of the field, and each one is special in its own way.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees have to play a game. They have to find ‘pairs’ of chuggers behind different-coloured roundhouse doors. Koko and Brewster do well, but easily-distracted Wilson fails the first time around. After a pep talk from Vee, he applies himself – and by concentrating really hard, he wins his badge!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmund tells the story of how, as a child, his father woke him up one morning before sunrise to show him the gift of dawn. Ever since then, Edmund wakes up very early every morning to enjoy it. Intrigued, Rosie, Berry, Scoutbadger and Woodsy ask to see the gift, but Edmund claims that they are still too little. They will have to wait one or two more years to know about it!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Bob takes Pilchard for her check-up, he discovers that the Vet Tilly is looking after a dog named Cooper... and he likes to chase cats. Vet Tilly panics as Mayor Madison is arriving that evening with her cat to be groomed. She doesn’t want Cooper to chase the Mayor’s cat! Bob suggests making a reception area that keeps cats and dogs separate and immediately the Vet commissions the build. Now working against the clock, Bob and the team have to complete the new reception area before the Mayor arrives. But on promising to keep the animals away from the building work, Leo accidentally lets Pilchard escape from her basket and doesn’t return to collect Cooper. Bob can’t continue his work until all the animals are out of the way.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is looking after Curtis’s garage while Leo takes him out for a birthday meal at Chef Tattie’s. However, the meal is a ruse, arranged so that Bob and his gang can secretly give Curtis’ workshop a makeover. Scoop is excited to be at the garage; he claims to have a great knowledge of mechanics. The build is all on schedule until Bob is forced to attend to Mr Bentley who keeps him busy because he’s very fussy about how much air he has in Philip’s tyres. At the restaurant Curtis is keen to get back to the garage as he is nervous about leaving it in somebody else’s hands. When Bob rings Leo and asks him to play for time Leo orders more and more food for himself to eat. At the, now busy, garage Scoop decides to take a look at what’s troubling Betsy, using the new vehicle inspection lift.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle, Lowly and Sally find a lost bag, they use the eyeglass case, atomizer, map, and a red scarf inside it to determine that the owner is a famous international opera star who’s come to Busytown to perform for the first time./Cyclists getting flat tires somewhere in Busytown lead Huckle and the gang on a mystery.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers are on a quest to reunite a lost Malayan tapir with its mother. But their visit to the rainforest leads them to another encounter with… the Malayan tiger!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo chances upon a dawn bat while sketching in his garden. The Junior Rangers embark on a search after sundown for the dawn bat’s cave.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: A foot race is going to take place at school tomorrow. Ferdinand is convinced that he is going to win. This bugs Simon big-time because he is just as convinced he will win. After all, Simon is the fastest! Especially if he is wearing his “fastest t-shirt in the world”, the one with the lightning bolt on it! He puts it on at home that evening and sure enough, he does everything super-duper fast. He eats in a blink, brushes his teeth at the speed of light. But the next morning at school, while all the other kids are putting on their gym clothes, Simon realizes that his fetish t-shirt isn’t in his bag!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The Firefly helps them, and with the assistance of the Moon, they swing on the Moon rocker seesaw. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Coco’s Hula Hoop. It’s harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset that she can’t hula anymore until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop teaches Bing and Pando how to blow bubbles. Bing finally blows a big bubble but gets upset when Pando pops it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula head off for a picnic at the paddling pool with Flop. But when they get there, they are shocked to find there is no water inside. Bing’s disappointment soon gives way to the realisation that it’s a very special pool day. With no water there are all sorts of games they can play that are usually against the pool rules.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda has invited her friends for Christmas, but a heavy snowfall prevents them from arriving. Luckily, Gertrude the mole digs a tunnel to Tilda’s house, ensuring the party can take place!

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One morning, Molly knocks excitedly on Tildas door: theres going to be a knitting competition in the village. Tilda and Molly at once set off to the village shop to buy some wool. All the other inhabitants of Wild Rose Lane are also buying knitting materials. The competition makes rivals of the friends and they work alone, quietly and secretly.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: It is almost winter in Wild Rose Lane and the inhabitants are getting their provisions in. Hedgehog Rupert is looking forward to hibernating. But Tilda is sad at the thought of all the nice things her best friend will miss while hes asleep. With the promise that she will cook for him, she persuades Rupert to stay awake and spend the winter at her place.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse are surprised to find an egg lying on the ground. Blue Bird agrees to look after it and when a rather odd and demanding bird hatches, she loves it like her own. When Little White Owl hears it calling one night, she tells them all that the ‘lucky chick’ is a baby owl and she will teach her all an owl needs to know.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse go on an adventurous journey through the woods in search of a special Autumn leaf. They leave a trail of acorns to find their way home, but Little Grey Squirrel unwittingly collects the acorns and leaves them all lost in the woods. Luckily he is able to help when he climbs to the treetops and spies the meadow in the distance.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Spring is coming and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are very brave and go on a journey through the meadow to discover the source of a mysterious – and slightly spooky - creaking sound. They follow the clues to discover… it’s the frozen lake melting, and singing as it does!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are playing tag in the snow-covered park. But the two brothers wind up getting into a little fight and Gaspard doesn’t want to play with Simon anymore because he keeps calling him a little baby. He’d rather gosledding with a little kid his own age. Simon is bugged and starts looking for someone to play with. He meets up with Emy, a big girl, who agrees to sled with him even though she thinks he’s kind of young!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo meets an Atlantic puffin in the garden while playing with his remote-controlled car. The Junior Rangers decide to take the puffin home to Iceland. There, Leo has a mishap at the edge of a cliff.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson has one hour to use the camera car to take pictures of three faults: one that’s up high, one that’s down low, and one that’s on something moving. Wilson spots a fault on something moving - Koko’s wagon - and wastes most of his time chasing her without ever getting a picture. Time’s up and Wilson thinks he’s failed his badge, as he’s only photographed two faults: a fallen signpost and faulty doors on a chute at the quarry. But Lori points out that not only is the chute is high up, but also its doors move – so that counts as two things and Wilson wins his badge!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn a passenger service badge, Wilson must speak up, be nice to his passengers, and smile at all times – no matter what happens! His passengers know that it’s a test, and go out of their way to make things very challenging for Wilson - but he keeps smiling and earns his badge.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina are very excited today as Mom and Dad have organized a treasure hunt for them in the forest! Tchoupi is very confident he’ll find the treasure in no time as he and Nina have prepared for it. As they move from clue to clue, the two friends have fun discovering other aspects of the forest, but Tchoupi starts to get impatient: why’s it taking so long to find the treasure??

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are busy playing as the chickens roam free in the orchard, pecking for food. But when it comes to bringing the birds back home, they notice Picorette is missing! They manage to track her down, nestling nice and cozy inside Loupiote the dog’s kennel, of all places! She’s come here to lay her eggs and she intends to stay! T’choupi and Nina try to coax her out with various treats… in vain. The problem is, Loupiote is out of a home right now!... But what if they were to find her another kennel??

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi gets a surprise when he finds out there’s a second donkey in the hamlet - a female donkey by the name of Cuddles. He and she hit it off immediately, so when Benedicte suggests they take the two donkeys for a walk in the forest, T’choupi and Nina are overjoyed! Only problem is, T’choupi pampers Cuddles so much that she keeps refusing to budge throughout the whole walk: she’d rather stop and chew on the “treats” along the way!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Say Papi, were there dinosaurs when you were little? asks Charley to his grandfather. All his friends would love to know the answer too. So Anna decides to invite Grandpa, who is a big fan of dinosaurs, to run a workshop on the subject. The big day arrives and Grandpa brings a cardboard box to school... and it starts to move! What if there was a real baby dinosaur inside?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: For the Great Neighborhood feast, each resident brings a square that best represents him or her, and that will join the big patchwork of the year. Sam help Julia to make her own square in time.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia got bored. GrandMa lend them a long knitting needle that is supposed to indicate them the direction of great things to do. It seems it works, but is the needle really a magical one?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
